intro: Cyrtanthus alboluteus, commonly known as the white-flowered glory bush, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant is part of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cyrtanthus alboluteus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate, long-lasting blooms.
